title: Combination Phone and Wallet Holder Invented by InventHelp Clients (NJD-918)
text:
Pittsburgh-based InventHelp is working to submit this idea, the EZ CASE, to companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 26, 2015
Are you tired of replacing broken cell phone covers? Well, thanks to the creativity of two inventors from Staten Island, N.J., there is now a much stronger and more reliable case with additional bonus features.
They developed a prototype for EZ CASE to prevent cracking and breaking of the case when phone is removed and replaced or dropped. In other words, it is durable for years of effective use. It, therefore, saves the time, effort and expense of having to replace a broken case. Their unique design also allows the user to remove a cell phone quickly and easily from the case. Furthermore, the compact size of the case makes it easier to conceal and keep valuables safe. It is also space-saving, lightweight and portable. In addition, it is easy to use, convenient and affordably priced.
The inventors were inspired by their personal experience. “We had a series of bad experiences with cell phone cases,” one of them said. “It seemed that no matter what type of case we bought, sooner or later, it would break with normal use while taking the phone out or putting it back inside.”
The original design was submitted to the New Jersey office of Invent Help. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-NJD-918, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
